section.section: Except as otherwise provided in this section, before suspending a permit, the Secretary shall give to the holder of the permit notice of intent to suspend.

The notice shall:
Specify with particularity the condition or violation that the Secretary believes to justify the suspension; and
State that the holder has an opportunity to correct the condition or violation before a time that is:

text.section:
The Secretary is not required to give notice of intent to suspend a permit if:
The violation creates an imminent hazard to public health; or
The holder of the permit has willfully refused to permit an authorized inspection.
If a permit has been suspended more than once, the Secretary may revoke the permit.
